How to get a Doodle
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 1 Archive (PSOne): Monsters: Doodle: How to get a Doodle
By MaJoBeRiDiOmEn! on Friday, May 12, 2000 - 11:38 pm:

hate monols? well then, you'd better learn to like them, since they can be the key to unlocking two rare monsters species and procuring two rare subbreeds.

To get a doodle, raise a purebred monol (monol/monol) up to c class while maintaining it's loyalty to 100 and its fame to 80-85. then battle your monol in a lower class tourney (i think it has to be an oficial cup, im just not sure; d-class works fine, e-class is what i usually join in). wil the tourney, and watch his fame plummet all the way to 50. next week, Holly will be surprised; your monol will be covered with graffitti, and will become a Scribble (monol/???). combine in the lab with any monster you have, and you will get either a purebred Doodle (doodle/doodle), or a Sketch (doodle/???).

By Anonymous on Thursday, February 8, 2001 - 09:55 am:

i was always told to get monol to B class.then again,I'm new to monster rancher.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, February 8, 2001 - 11:52 am:

B-class works as well. It just has to have their fame plummet by several points. And the easiest (and fastest) way is in C-class. Although the higher it goes, the faster you lose the fame.

Also, it doesn't have to be official. As long as the tourney is lower than what the monol went into.

By Anonymous on Thursday, February 8, 2001 - 12:17 pm:

Really!?Doodle here I come!!!

By Eagle Fierce on Thursday, February 8, 2001 - 06:49 pm:

I've raised a Doodle. They're odd little 2-d monsters, but think of a Golem-sized monster with a Pixie's GUTS regen, and toss in some wacky attacks and you have the gist of a Doodle. Anime, my first Doodle, was fun to raise and got good stat gains in most areas except skill. Sadly, Doodle's attacks are in a C and D Hit% It never did much on expeditions, though. Still, i highly recommend it is not just for a good laugh. besides, where else can you see a giant chicken motorcycle :D

By Anonymous on Saturday, February 10, 2001 - 08:24 pm:

By Eagle Fierce on Sunday, February 11, 2001 - 01:04 pm:

Yes, it won't say anything, but trust me it'll be a Doodle.

By Eagle Fierce on Sunday, February 11, 2001 - 11:54 pm:

Good question. It's difficult to really tell in MR1 with all of the influence on battles and training, but mine lived for a good 7 and a half years. I'm still trying to figure out why all of my monsters die around the half year mark, though ^_^ Anyways, enjoy the Doodle.
